title: Drawing, "Designs for Souvenir Fans for the 1867 Paris Exposition Universelle", 1866–67
medium: Transparent water color and white gouache on off-white wove paper
inscribed:
Upper left, graphite: No 8
Lower left, graphite: No 32 (crossed out)
Upper right, graphite: 154, distance des medallions, apartive du milieu de la gorge 
Lower right center, graphite: drawn distance line at center of fan, distance de la gorge
description:
Center: man and woman on horseback, trees, signpost in orange ground
Left: 17th-century cavalier walking a dog, hexagonal green ground
Right: 17th-century cavalier with hunting horn and staff on hexagonal green ground

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Designs for Souvenir Fans for the 1867 Paris Exposition Universelle", 1866–67.Transparent water color and white gouache on off-white wove paper. Gift of M. Roy Fisher. 1976-105-9.
